title: 9-year-old accidentally shoots self in Iredell County; caregiver arrested
content:
IREDELL COUNTY, N.C. —
A woman was arrested after a 9-year-old boy left in her care accidentally shot himself early Wednesday, Iredell County deputies said.
Brenda Moore Rucker, 66, of Troutman, was charged with felony child abuse with serious physical injury and failure to store a firearm to protect minors.
The boy was shot in the leg around 12:35 a.m. and was listed in good condition at a Charlotte hospital as of Friday morning.
The shooting happened in a bedroom where the boy and his sister were watching TV, Iredell County deputies said. The .357 revolver belonged to Rucker, who was asleep in a chair at the time of the incident, deputies said.
The gun, which Rucker had for only a few months, was usually wrapped in a cloth rag and placed in a toboggan on a cabinet shelf behind Rucker's chair, deputies said. Rucker told deputies she wasn't aware of anyone else knowing the gun was there, and she didn't hear anyone reach for the gun.
Rucker had been taking care of the two children since August 1, and she also has two handicapped adults in the home, deputies said.
Rucker was held in jail under a $30,000 secured bond.
